screen_desc: The screenshot shows the "Picture-in-picture" settings for various apps on a smartphone. It lists Chrome, Google Play Movies & TV, Google Play services, Maps, and YouTube, with YouTube being the only app currently allowed to use picture-in-picture.
action_think: The user wants to turn off picture-in-picture for all apps. I have already turned off picture-in-picture for Chrome and Google Play Movies & TV apps. I need to enable the 'Not allowed' option for maps and YouTube apps.
action_plan: Enable the 'Not allowed' option for Maps
Enable the 'Not allowed' option for YouTube
action_desc: click on the Maps app located at the upper middle part of the screen
action_result: I have turned off the picture-in-picture feature for the Google Play services app. This will prevent the app from creating a window while it's open or after you leave it, which is what you wanted.
prev_action_result: By clicking on the back button, I have returned to the main Picture-in-Picture settings page. This is necessary because it allows us to switch to the settings for the specific application, which is the Google Play Movies & TV app in this case. As you requested to turn off picture-in-picture for this app, I will now proceed to toggle the switch next to "Google Play Movies & TV" to allow or disallow this feature. This alignment with your user request is crucial for managing app permissions effectively.
